summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing the military intervention in Libya against Gaddafi. It includes comments from Arab League chief Amr Moussa regarding the situation in Libya and the unintended consequences of the intervention. The email emphasizes confidentiality and attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email discussing the military actions in Libya.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email from Epstein.

persons.name: Amr Moussa
persons.context: Moussa is quoted in the email expressing concerns about the military intervention in Libya.

events.title: Military Intervention in Libya
events.description: US forces launched warplanes and cruise missiles against Gaddafi as part of a UN-backed intervention.

keyFacts: The email discusses the US military intervention in Libya against Gaddafi.
Amr Moussa criticized the intervention, stating it was not aligned with the original aim of protecting civilians.
The email emphasizes confidentiality and attorney-client privilege.
